column49: A beautiful but threatened bat.  Feeds on wild almonds; nectar; tamarind; tropical wild rose apples and guavas. In general this bat does not appear to be a major pollinator; indicating that consumption of pollen is probably not substantial

column36: These bats skim across water to wet their fur and drink or thermoregulate; apparently they can swim but they look miserable as they do so and cannot launch directly out of water; they are adept climbers; they can climb from the base to crown of a tree should they fall to the ground; seasonal migration in pursuit of flowers is recorded
column49: Blossom is their main food; they will eat fruit as a last resort
